description: From Middle English tempestuous, tempestious, variants of tempestous, from Old French tempesteus, tempestos, tempestuose, from Latin tempestuōsus, equivalent to tempest +‎ -uous.

adjectives.description: tempestuous (comparative more tempestuous, superlative most tempestuous)

entries.meaning: Of, or resembling, a tempest; stormy, tumultuous.
